sentence.Network_en: Now he was in deep affliction for the loss of his brother.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在他正为丧弟之痛万分忧伤.

sentence.Network_en: His deafness is a great affliction to him.

list.abs: We should help people in affliction ., 我们应该帮助在苦难之中的人们.
此外,还有第三种意识——烦恼识(afflicted consciousness),又称为“末那识”或思量识、作意识、相续识、分别识。烦恼识没有明性,经常都处于充满“我”的念头及.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (originally in the sense 'infliction of pain or humiliation', specifically 'religious self-mortification'): via Old French from Latin afflictio(n-), from the verb affligere (see afflict)

entry.def: An affliction is something which causes physical or mental suffering.

example.ex: Hay fever is an affliction which arrives at an early age.
example.tran: 枯草热是年纪较小时会患的一种病。

means.word_mean: 1. a state of great suffering and distress due to adversity
2. a condition of suffering or distress due to ill health
3. a cause of great suffering and distress

stems_affixes.word_buile: af一再+flict打+ion表名词→一再打→折磨
inflict[v.使遭受[损伤,苦痛等],使承受[on,upon]]+ion表名词→n.[强加于人身的]痛苦,刑罚

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使身体或精神受痛苦,折磨
使遭受[损伤,苦痛等],使承受[on,upon]
stems_affixes.word_buile: in进入+flict打击→进入打斗→导致痛苦

sentences.cn: 忍受苦难, 不屈不挠

means.word_mean: 灾难，祸害，不幸的事，痛苦的事

sentences.en: His deafness is a great affliction to him.
Afflictions are sometimes blessings in disguise.
